fields.summary: [Rust] Add Rust to the format integration testing

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

andygrove opened a new pull request #7220:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7220


   I'm hacking away, trying to get the first integration test to pass. Null support is important and this is how far I have got so far.
   
   The intent is not to merge this PR necessarily, but to figure out what's involved.

andygrove commented on pull request #7220:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7220#issuecomment-630806944


   Thanks @nevi-me there is a README in the new integration-testing crate which pretty much just links to the integration testing docs [1]. I have been testing against the Java implementation, so I have been building the Rust and Java projects then using the following archery command:
   
   ```
   archery integration --with-java=true --with-rust=true
   ```
   
   [1] https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docs/source/format/Integration.rst

andygrove commented on pull request #7220:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7220#issuecomment-630821367


   At first glance it looks like you are just in the wrong directory. You need
   to run archery from the root of the repo. Then it would look for
   java/pom.xml and find it.
   
   On Tue, May 19, 2020 at 7:30 AM Wakahisa <notifications@github.com> wrote:
   
   > I keep getting the below on Windows. I'll try with Linux

nevi-me commented on pull request #7220:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7220#issuecomment-631020629


   @andygrove I still can't run the tests locally, so I'm flying blind for now. I've pushed 2 commits adding `NullArray` support. I couldn't find an example of how a null array looks like in JSON, so I'm unsure if I implemented the `JsonEquals` correctly.
   
   I believe the commits should give us enough to progress with the integration testing. I'll try complete the null support as soon as I can.

nevi-me commented on pull request #7220:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7220#issuecomment-631667439


   @andygrove I think I'm done with the null array. Please let me know if the approach of allocating a null buffer is fine. It's one way to ensure that `is_valid(n: usize) == false`. I could alternatively override `Array::is_null(&self, index)` and friends.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7220#issuecomment-631799056


   I ran the tests again with the latest changes, test failures are still the same. These are the unique errors I see from the Rust side:
   
   ```
   Error: IoError("Reading types other than record batches not yet supported")
   Error: JsonError("data type Date32(Day) not supported")
   Error: ParseError("invalid or unsupported type name: \"largebinary\" in Object({\"name\": String(\"largebinary\")})")
   ```

nevi-me commented on pull request #7220:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7220#issuecomment-631883352


   The first makes sense as we don't support all `ipc::Message` types
   
   I couldn't see what triggers the second, but I suspect it might be something small
   
   On the third, we don't support large lists yet, so that'll fail until we add support for them
